components.description:
An everyday flashlight (electric torch), as used when the power goes out, camping, or telling scary stories. Generally depicted at a 45° angle as a gray and black device with a switch, shown illuminated on many platforms.

Used for various content concerning and senses of light and lighting (e.g., spotlight).

Google’s flashlight was previously orange.
components.title: Electric Torch

description:

title: Electric Torch

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Tool symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A flashlight emoji, known as a torch outside of North America. Used when in the dark â€“ either when the electricity is out, or when camping.  http://emojipedia.org/electric-torch/
emoji_net_data.name: flashlight

bn:00035073n: A small portable battery-powered electric lamp
A flashlight is a hand-held portable electrically-powered light source, and is often called a torch in areas outside of North America.
A portable light source powered by electricity; a flashlight.
A power source for a portable device.
